intro: Racosperma stipulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves with slender, stipulate leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or cream-colored, arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes. Racosperma stipulosum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
